title: Multiple buffer over reads in mbox_from_parse

profile.name: Open-Xchange
profile.about: Messaging, collaboration and office productivity software for service providers

vulnerability_information_html:
Vulnerabilities were found fuzzing mbox_from_parse

Different inputs reproducing the behavior are

0xe7,0xdf,0x1,0x0,0x30,0x3f,0x20,0x32,0x20,0x30,0x3a,0x32,0x39,0x20,0x3f,0x3f,0x3f,0x20,0x34,0x39,0x30,0x34,0xdb,0x32,0x32,0x3a,0x32,0x36,
0x20,0x32,0x20,0x56,0x3f,0x3f,0x3f,0x3f,0x20,0x33,0x20,0x32,0x30,0x3a,0x32,0x30,0x3a,0x32,0x32,0x20,0x2d,0x32,
0x20,0xff,0xf6,0xff,0xff,0x3f,0x3f,0x3f,0x20,0x34,0x20,0x32,0x34,0x3a,0x32,0x34,0x3a,0x32,0x34,0x20,0x32,0x34,

Patch could be adding checks with regards to msg_end 

diff --git a/src/lib-mail/mbox-from.c b/src/lib-mail/mbox-from.c
index 452e32ea02..46e0a27ab1 100644
--- a/src/lib-mail/mbox-from.c
+++ b/src/lib-mail/mbox-from.c
@@ -188,8 +188,8 @@ int mbox_from_parse(const unsigned char *msg, size_t size,
        /* optional named timezone */
        if (alt_stamp)
                ;
-       else if (!i_isdigit(msg[0]) || !i_isdigit(msg[1]) ||
-                !i_isdigit(msg[2]) || !i_isdigit(msg[3])) {
+       else if (msg_end > msg+3 && ( !i_isdigit(msg[0]) || !i_isdigit(msg[1]) ||
+                !i_isdigit(msg[2]) || !i_isdigit(msg[3]))) {
                /* skip to next space */
                while (msg < msg_end && *msg != ' ') {
                        if (*msg == '\r' || *msg == '\n')
@@ -199,7 +199,7 @@ int mbox_from_parse(const unsigned char *msg, size_t size,
                if (msg+5 > msg_end)
                        return -1;
                msg++;
-       } else if ((msg[0] == '-' || msg[0] == '+') &&
+       } else if (msg_end > msg+5 && (msg[0] == '-' || msg[0] == '+') &&
                   i_isdigit(msg[1]) && i_isdigit(msg[2]) &&
                   i_isdigit(msg[3]) && i_isdigit(msg[4]) && msg[5] == ' ') {
                /* numeric timezone, use it */
@@ -212,13 +212,13 @@ int mbox_from_parse(const unsigned char *msg, size_t size,

        if (!alt_stamp) {
                /* year */
-               if (mbox_parse_year(msg, &tm) < 0)
+               if (msg + 4 < msg_end && mbox_parse_year(msg, &tm) < 0)
                        return -1;
                msg += 4;
        }

        tm.tm_isdst = -1;
-       if (!seen_timezone && msg != msg_end &&
+       if (!seen_timezone && msg + 5 < msg_end &&
            msg[0] == ' ' && (msg[1] == '-' || msg[1] == '+') &&
            i_isdigit(msg[2]) && i_isdigit(msg[3]) &&
            i_isdigit(msg[4]) && i_isdigit(msg[5])) {

Impact

A buffer over read may result in sensitive data leak, or in a crash if it accesses another memory page

I am not sure if the impact is security sensitive, so I preferred to report it here first

activities.message: Hi! Thanks for reporting this, we'll take a look.
activities.markdown_message: Hi! Thanks for reporting this, we'll take a look.

Hm. On line 100 there is already check for 

if (msg+29-3-5 > msg_end)
   return -1;

Is this somehow skipped?

activities.message:
The check is not skipped, but it is not enough :
29-3-5 = 21 bytes

And then we have
line 106: msg+=4 (17 remaining)

Then it depends on the branch.
But we can get :
line 112,117,121,125 each does `msg++` (13 remaining)
line 129: msg+=5 (8 remaining)
line 133: msg+=4 (4 remaining)
line 160: msg+=3 (1 remaining)
line 166: msg+=2 -> we already overread
activities.markdown_message:
The check is not skipped, but it is not enough :
29-3-5 = 21 bytes

And then we have
line 106: msg+=4 (17 remaining)

Then it depends on the branch.
But we can get :
line 112,117,121,125 each does msg++ (13 remaining)
line 129: msg+=5 (8 remaining)
line 133: msg+=4 (4 remaining)
line 160: msg+=3 (1 remaining)
line 166: msg+=2 -> we already overread

activities.message: this can be induced by having eml file that starts with `From sender@domain rfc822-date`, the parser is attempting to parse this line.
activities.markdown_message: this can be induced by having eml file that starts with From sender@domain rfc822-date, the parser is attempting to parse this line.

activities.message:
I can only get valgrind to report 1 byte overflow ("Invalid read of size 1"). Also with the inputs provided above. Can you somehow see more than 1 byte overflow? I tested the 1 byte overflow anyway with a script, but there were no errors/crashes produced:

```
#!/bin/bash -eu

for i in {1..10000}; do
  echo $i
  perl -e 'print "From ".("x"x$ARGV[0])." Fri, 2 Jan 1970 10:14\n"' $i |
    /usr/local/libexec/dovecot/dovecot-lda -d tss
done
```
activities.markdown_message:
I can only get valgrind to report 1 byte overflow ("Invalid read of size 1"). Also with the inputs provided above. Can you somehow see more than 1 byte overflow? I tested the 1 byte overflow anyway with a script, but there were no errors/crashes produced:

#!/bin/bash -eu

for i in {1..10000}; do
  echo $i
  perl -e 'print "From ".("x"x$ARGV[0])." Fri, 2 Jan 1970 10:14\n"' $i |
    /usr/local/libexec/dovecot/dovecot-lda -d tss
done

activities.message: Hmm... I guess this is indeed limited to one byte over read as the next bytes are only read if a condition is met on this first byte... To get a crash with a one byte overread, we should try to have the buffer fill exactly a 4096 bytes memory page... What do you think ?
activities.markdown_message: Hmm... I guess this is indeed limited to one byte over read as the next bytes are only read if a condition is met on this first byte... To get a crash with a one byte overread, we should try to have the buffer fill exactly a 4096 bytes memory page... What do you think ?

activities.message: Closing as this has no security impact.
activities.markdown_message: Closing as this has no security impact.
